metadata.description: Global rarity system configuration - thresholds and component multipliers for weight-based rarity calculation
notes: Rarity emerges from component combinations rather than being pre-assigned
Component weights can vary within categories (e.g., Steel=20, Mithril=50, Dragonbone=100)
RarityCalculator service computes final rarity from component weights + multipliers
ContentBuilder shows live rarity preview as components are selected
Adjust individual component weights and category multipliers to fine-tune rarity distribution

legendary.description: Artifacts of immense power, unique named items

material.description: Base multiplier for material components (Iron, Steel, Mithril)
material.reasoning: Materials are the foundation of item quality

quality.description: Multiplier for craftsmanship quality (Fine, Superior, Masterwork)

prefix.description: Multiplier for prefix modifiers (Flaming, Keen, Brutal)
prefix.reasoning: Prefixes add substantial power, full weight impact

suffix.description: Multiplier for suffix modifiers (of Slaying, of Power)
suffix.reasoning: Suffixes are less impactful than prefixes, slight reduction

base.description: Multiplier for base item type (Longsword, Battleaxe)
base.reasoning: Base items have minimal rarity impact - anyone can craft one

descriptive.description: Multiplier for descriptive components (Ancient, Enchanted, Cursed)
descriptive.reasoning: Descriptive elements add flavor but less mechanical impact

enchantment.description: Multiplier for enchantment components (of Fire, of Ice)

title.description: Multiplier for title components (of the Dragon, of the Hero)
title.reasoning: Titles add prestige, moderate rarity impact

origin.description: Multiplier for origin components (Elven, Dwarven, Dragon)
origin.reasoning: Exotic origins increase rarity slightly above standard

size.description: Multiplier for size modifiers (Small, Large, Massive)
size.reasoning: Size alone doesn't dramatically affect rarity

color.description: Multiplier for color descriptors (Red, Blue, Golden)
color.reasoning: Color is cosmetic, minimal rarity impact

condition.description: Multiplier for condition states (Worn, Pristine, Ruined)
condition.reasoning: Condition affects value but not inherent rarity

common_sword.name: Iron Longsword
common_sword.reasoning: Basic material + basic weapon = common item

uncommon_sword.name: Fine Steel Longsword
uncommon_sword.reasoning: Quality craftsmanship + refined material = uncommon item

rare_sword.name: Masterwork Mithril Longsword of Sharpness
rare_sword.reasoning: Exceptional craftsmanship + rare material + enchantment = epic item

legendary_sword.name: Ancient Elven Dragonbone Greatsword of the Dragon King
legendary_sword.reasoning: Ancient + exotic origin + legendary material + prestigious title = legendary item
